snippet: Consumer confidence, China’s slowing growth and a record Spanish debt contribute to a market downturn.
abstract: Standard & Poor’s 500-stock index suffers its biggest weekly decline of 2012, as consumer confidence drops, China’s growth slows and the cost of insuring against a Spanish debt default rises to a record level.
lead_paragraph: Consumer confidence, China’s slowing growth and a record Spanish debt contribute to a market downturn.

headline.seo: S.& P. 500 Suffers Biggest Weekly Decline of the Year
headline.main: S.& P. 500 Suffers Biggest Weekly Decline of the Year
headline.print_headline: S.& P. 500 Suffers Biggest Weekly Decline of the Year
